lead_paragraph: A measure being considered by Gov. Nathan Deal would strengthen legal protections for opponents of same-sex marriage.

headline.print_headline: A Clash of Religious and Business Interests in Georgia
headline.main: Business to Play Key Role as Georgia Weighs Bill on Religion and Gay Rights

snippet: A measure being considered by Gov. Nathan Deal would strengthen legal protections for opponents of same-sex marriage.
abstract: Georgia Gov Nathan Deal is considering signing religious freedom bill, passed by state's General Assembly, that gives greater legal protection to faith-based groups opposing same-sex marriage; supporters see bill as answer to Supreme Court’s legalization of same-sex marriage, but many business leaders and gay rights activists view such a law as discriminatory.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
